channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s Pick as Mideast Adviser, Massad Boulos, Is a Truck Salesman
item.description: The lore around Massad Boulos, Tiffany Trump’s father-in-law, is that he is a billionaire dealmaker. Records show otherwise.

item.title: Exclusive: This 31-year-old Google alum raised $75 million for a frontier tech fund backed by Marc Andreessen and a cofounder of OpenAI
item.description: Casey Caruso thinks that investors who deeply understand technology will win.

item.title: Biden Commutes the Sentences of Nearly 1,500 Americans, a Record for One Day
item.description: Most of those being granted clemency had been placed in home confinement during the pandemic. Some Republicans have tried to push legislation that wou...

item.title: Adani Group, a Symbol of India’s Soft Power, Stumbles After Indictments
item.description: Countries in Asia, Africa and elsewhere have been distancing themselves from Gautam Adani, the Indian magnate, after accusations of bribery and conspi...

item.title: How Covid Can Change Your Gut
item.description: Diarrhea, constipation, pain, bloating: We asked experts why the virus causes these issues and what to do about them.

item.title: Shark Tank judge Daymond John reveals a 3 step approach for building wealth that anyone can follow
item.description: Lucky breaks or keen investments are nothing without strategy and long-term vision.

item.title: How U.S. Firms Battled a Government Crackdown to Keep Tech Sales to China
item.description: An intense struggle has unfolded in Washington between companies and officials over where to draw the line on selling technology to China.

item.title: Your next Marriott hotel room might be a cabin in the woods
item.description: The world’s largest hotel company is adding tiny cabins and nature retreats, on the heels of similar moves by Hyatt and Hilton.

item.title: How U.S. Firms Battled a Government Crackdown to Keep Tech Sales to China
item.description: An intense struggle has unfolded in Washington between companies and officials over where to draw the line on selling technology to China.

item.title: F.B.I. Looks Into Plot Targeting Athletes as Joe Burrow’s Home Is Burglarized
item.description: The homes of a handful of N.B.A. and N.F.L. players in the Midwest have been burglarized since September. The F.B.I. believes “South American Theft Gr...

item.title: How I sent Buzz Lightyear to space—and what it taught me about innovation
item.description: Getting a Pixar toy up to the International Space Station took bravery and creativity, says Disney alum Duncan Wardle.

item.title: Man Found in Syria Says He Is Missing American Travis Timmerman
item.description: The man told reporters that his name was Travis Timmerman and that he had entered Syria on a religious pilgrimage. He said he had been detained for mo...

item.title: CNBC is reportedly planning a streaming service
item.description: Stand-alone service is set to launch in the first quarter of 2025.

item.title: U.S. Appeals for Unity Behind New Syrian Government After Fall of Assad Regime
item.description: The secretary of state said the goal of visits to Jordan and Turkey was to unite countries behind a peaceful transition.

item.title: Syria Live Updates: Israel Says Its Troops Will Stay in Seized Territory for Now
